alert.note: Alert for Barton; Cedar; Dade; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 09 at 6:46PM CDT until May 09 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Barton County in southwestern Missouri... Cedar County in southwestern Missouri... St. Clair County in west central Missouri... Southeastern Vernon County in west central Missouri... Northwestern Dade County in southwestern Missouri... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 645 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Montrose to near Walker to 6 miles northwest of Lamar to Cherokee, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Stockton Lake, Truman Lake, Stockton State Park, Lamar, El Dorado Springs, Stockton, Greenfield, Appleton City, Osceola, Lockwood, Golden City, Lowry City, Montevallo, Jerico Springs, Lamar Heights, Collins, Roscoe, South Greenfield, Arcola and Vista. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 57 and 70. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Cedar; Dade; St. Clair; Vernon
